What we do
    Our activities include:
  • Provision of humanitarian aid
  • Provision of essential drugs for elderly and the disabled
  • Assistance in evacuation of people from frontline areas
  • Assistance in legalisation of residency abroad and resettlement in Europe
  • Help for Ukrainian army and territorial defense forces
  • Assistance for other foundations in finding contractors and coordination of volunteering activities
  • On-line psychological support service
Do you want to become a volunteer?
Our foundation aims to reach the widest range of people and provide them with help. After all, it is impossible to stay away when having the resources and opportunities.

About us
Introduction of the European Defense Readiness Chamber and EDRCh Foundation
We consider it essential to create a safe environment that will not be economically and energetically dependent on the individual powers. As a European Security Readiness Chamber, it is essential to include institutions and organizations in Ukraine in assistance projects and processes, in such a way as to assist that country in the process of independence and subsequently in other processes that will ensure its full readiness. to join the EU and NATO and speed up the whole accession process.

The European Defense Readiness Chamber (abbreviated EDRCH) was registered on 05.05.2021 in Prague in order to unify the supply network in the Czech Republic and the Slovak Republic, with subsequent expansion to other NATO and EU countries.

In light of the current situation associated with the invasion of Ukraine by Russia, EDRCh has established an Fundation EDRCh, which will focus on supporting all necessary, in the involvement and cooperation of all governmental and non-governmental organizations not only in the Czech Republic, Slovakia but also in other European countries so that they can help Ukraine in terms of health, medical care, humanitarian supply, education for children or assistance in placing people fleeing the war in the labor market.
